# Care Economy Time-Use Analysis

This notebook explores gender-disaggregated time use across paid work, unpaid care work, and rest.

## ğŸ“¦ Packages Required

```{r setup, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyr)
```

## ğŸ“‚ Load Data

```{r}
data <- read.csv("timeuse_sample.csv")
head(data)
```

## ğŸ§¹ Handle Missing Values

```{r}
colSums(is.na(data))
data_clean <- data %>%
  filter(!is.na(gender), !is.na(paid_work_hrs), !is.na(unpaid_care_hrs), !is.na(rest_hrs))
```

## ğŸ”„ Pivot to Long Format

```{r}
long_data <- data_clean %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c("paid_work_hrs", "unpaid_care_hrs", "rest_hrs"),
               names_to = "activity",
               values_to = "hours")
```

## ğŸ“Š Summarise by Gender and Activity

```{r}
summary_table <- long_data %>%
  group_by(gender, activity) %>%
  summarise(mean_hours = mean(hours), .groups = "drop")

print(summary_table)
```

## ğŸ“ˆ Visualise Time Use

```{r}
ggplot(summary_table, aes(x = activity, y = mean_hours, fill = gender)) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Average Time Use by Gender", y = "Mean Hours", x = "Activity") +
  theme_minimal()
```

## ğŸ§ª Sanity Checks

```{r}
stopifnot(all(data_clean$paid_work_hrs >= 0))
stopifnot(length(unique(data_clean$gender)) == 2)
```
